Half Life serisini büyük bir keyifle oynayıp bitiren, eli levyeli birisi olduğum için diğer oyunlarını da severek oynuyorum. Bir fan gibi düşünerek, bunların yaptığı oyunların hepsi iyidir diye bir yorumda bulunacak değilim ama. Sadece bunu neden tavsiye ettiğimi belirtebilirim.

Oyunun konusu bakımından Half Life serisi ile bir bağlantısı var zaten. Hatta Portal sadece bir bulmaca oyunu olarak değerlendirilip Half Life'ın ilerideki oyunu için kullanılacak (Gravity Gun gibi) bir silah olduğu söylentileri vardı ama herkes Portal'ı çok sevdi ve devamı geldi. 

Benim en çok ilgimi çeken kısmı oyunda TR altyazı seçeneğinin de olması oldu (ayrıca Steam'da Half Life 2'de Türkçeleştirildi, diğer oyunlarda da bunu bekliyoruz eheheh). Diğer iyi yönlerini de maddeler halinde yazacağım:

-Çeşitli bulmacaları çözmek oldukça eğlenceli. Özellikle bulmacaların yanında GLaDOS'un ilk oyundaki fiş acısı (kuyruk acısı hesabı) nedeniyle bize ikide bir laf sokması vs daha da keyifli bir hâle getiriyor olayı.

-Wheatley adındaki robo yardımcımızın gevezeliği de konuşmayan karakterimizin sessizliğini unutturuyor (Gordon'un kayıp ikizi sanırım bu kadın).

-Özellikle multiplayer kısmı arkadaşlarla oynamak için çok keyifli. Minik robotlarımızın (multideki) şaklabanlıkları ayrı bir keyifli oluyor. Ayrıca oyundaki mic olayı sayesinde (multi oyunların vazgeçilmezi diyebiliriz artık) arkadaşlara laf sokmak vs oldukça eğlenceli. En güzeli de oyundan sıkılsanız bile arkadaşınıza geçeceği bir portal açıp onu suyun dibine gönderebilmeniz ya da parçalara ayrılmasına neden olabilmeniz.

İlk oyundaki çizgisinden bir şey kaybetmeyip, aksine üstüne bir şeyler koymuş olması da yeterince iyi bence.

Yukarıda söylediğim gibi oyunda TR altyazı seçeneğinin olması yeterince güzel bir olay. Almanızı tavsiye ediyorum o yüzden.

Portal 2 is amazing... from the start to the finish... its a bit more in depth than the original Portal... all the way from the moment you get woken up by the adorable, clumsy, a little bit of an idiot, british speaking personality core named Wheatley, to that final, breathtaking battle at the end... 1000 portals out of 1000! 

One of my favorite lines from the games...: You may have a minor case, of severe brain damage... 

*spoiler... kinda* THE GAME COMPLETELY FLIPS UPSIDE DOWN HALF WAY THOUGH... its amazing!
The original Portal was great and Portal 2 is even better.   Everyone should play this game.  :)

One of my first 10 games I've purchased on steam, and to this day, my favourite game over Dota and Isaac. Some might tell you the puzzle isn't as intricate as Portal 1, however it, perfected the portal franchise, it added an amazing story to an otherwise amazing puzzle game. Yes I only have 14 hours on it, thats because my favourite part of the game isnt the puzzle solving (which is a whole other amazing element of the game) but the story. The voice acting was so good, by the end of chapter two I was drawn into the main character, "a lifeless robot speaking to a women who never responds". This says enough about the story.
The co-op mode is one of the best experience you can have with a friend, it's hours of fun regardless if you are solving the puzzles, or screwing over your friends. 
If you dont have this game still, buy it now, for the price of some McDonals, you get an amazing experience

portal 2,
what can i say about this game well almost everything. first of all the game is not and ill repeat *not* only for valve/portal/half life fans its for everybody the game have an amazing campaign with amazing story that well somehow connected to half life story but its not making people that dont know about the franchise have less of a amazing expeirence its challenging and intresting and you actully want to play another episode everytime you end the previouse one its not just the story or the gameplay but also the graphics and the *physics* now let me tell you one thing - if valve know's to do something its artificial intelligence and physics in games (if you playd playd half life you preobebly know what im talking about) and if that is not enough and you arn't satisfied from the campaign neither its because of the story or the gameplay you can create your own test chamber's! (kind of challenge) and then share with your friend in the workshop you can also play other people test chamber's with 2 mods single player and coop both of them are amazing and fun 
by the way you'll never and listen very well NEVER have boring time in this game so many stuff to do that you never gonna feel a lack of mssions/polishing and stuff to do 
one last thing if you intrested of buying the game i recomend buy two pack its cheaper and if you have a friend with this game youll have X2 more experience 
i highly recomnd this game and if you have money to spent, spent it on this game youll never regret this decision

Wow, and I thought the first Portal was amazing with it's limited dialogue interaction and awesome first-person puzzle gameplay (which still delivered and exceptional storyline). If you enjoy puzzles, then most definitely partake in this game.

Portal 2 takes the framework set forth from its predecessor and transforms it into the Burj Khalifa of the gaming world.

It doesn't go too overboard on any one section of development and each elements plays to the strengths of the other with the gameplay, story, and visuals. Voice Acting particularly is superb, even in yet another game where the protagonist is absolutely silent.

I absolutely recommend Portal 2.

The only main gripe is that the game, while exceptional, is your standard fare of about 8-12 hours of gameplay. There's an extended community for puzzles as well as online puzzles, but once you've played through the main storyline there really isn't a great incentive to IMMEDIATELY replay the game. To relive moments later on, yes, but otherwise, no.

But, it's still worth it even at it's current price tag, whatever it may be.
